result.execSummary:
The defendant Harvey C Laurich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm on Grounds of a School, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.605(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $1,866.00 entered as ordered by the court on07/14/15 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 07/01/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.

Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs.
The defendant shall repay Milwaukee County the monthly amount of $50.00, payable to the Clerk of Circuit Court, on or before the 1st day of every month starting on 6/1/15 until the total amount of $1,866.00 is repaid.
Signed and filed.
Per Request and Order to correct signed on 6/18/2015:  assessments/monetary amounts entered into CCAP/JOC as ordered.
to Correct Clerical record.

Actual assessment were not put in CCAP/on JOC as should be. Monetary amounts are not shown.
CORRECTION: to enter  assessment/monetary amounts as ordered.
records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: DUPLICATE, PRINTED IN ERROR

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by the State, Defense counsel and defendant.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 90  DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for Zero days served. 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for  1  year with the following conditions:
- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
- No fine
- Provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge
- Pay costs, fees, assessments, and all surcharges by 08-11-2015.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Harvey C Laurich in court with attorney Christopher R Smith.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he may be deported if not a U.S. citizen, he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample, pay the mandatory DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

No PSI ordered.  Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

received from Nick Berg, Ken and Lynn Laurich.

Plea/sentencing hearing on January 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Parties are being notified that effective December 1, 2014 this case will be assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 7, in Room 629 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Harvey C Laurich in court with attorney Christopher R Smith.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests case be set for Plea and Sentencing. Court orders case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 01-23-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Harvey C Laurich in court with attorney Christopher R Smith.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for oral ruling. Court denied defense motions for reasons stated on the record. Defense counsel requests additional time to speak with the defendant about how they intend to proceed. Court grants request. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's Brief in Opposition to Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Complaint, received and filed.
State's Motion for Extension of Time To File Response Brief, received and filed.

Defendant Harvey C Laurich in court with attorney Christopher R. Smith.  Denis Stingl for Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense addresses the Motion filed on 7/28/2014. Court orders case adjourned for Oral Decision on 10-21-2014 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.
State's response to the Defendant's Motion is due 9-19-2014 at 5:00 p.m. and any written response from the Defense due on 10-3-2014 at 5:00 p.m.  Oral ruling scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Case calendared for SCHEDULING on 8/26/2014 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Harvey C Laurich in court with attorney Christopher R. Smith. Stephan Nolten for Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Per the Chief Judge Branch 15 is not keeping this case. Parties advised this case is being reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
NOTICE OF MOTION TO DISMISS THE CRIMINAL COMPLAINT BASED ON THE UNCONSTUTIONALITY OF WIS.STATS.SECTION 948.605

Defendant Harvey C Laurich in court with attorney Christopher R Smith.  Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for MOTION HEARING on 9/2/2014 at 1:30 pm. Any motions are to be filed by 7/28/2014 at any response from the State is to be filed by 8/29/2014.

Defendant Harvey C Laurich in court with attorney Christopher  Smith.  Denis Stingl for Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Harvey C Laurich in court.  Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears in Court without Counsel.  
Defendant is not Public Defender eligible.   Court conducted indigency hearing and appointed Atty. Christopher Smith to represent defendant at County expense and at the rate of $60/hour.  Court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50/month starting June 1, 2015 with authorization for repayment through civil judgment, tax intercept or wage assignment.  Appointment of Attorney at County Expense signed and filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Harvey C Laurich in court.  Hanna Kolberg for Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant appears without counsel.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.   Court suspends the proceedings and orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Same Bail.  
  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Harvey C Laurich in court with attorney Dudley A Williams.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on  4-25-2014 at 1:00pm
